processed.result:
You are given two integers, $n$ and $p$, representing the number of buyers and the price of one apple, respectively.  

Each of the next $n$ lines describes a buyer. The line will contain either "half" or "halfplus". 

* "half" means the buyer purchased half the apples available at the time.
* "halfplus" means the buyer purchased half the apples available at the time and received an additional half apple as a gift.

Determine the total amount of money the seller should have at the end of the day. 

**Note:**

* The seller starts with at least one apple and has no apples left at the end of the day.
* The price of an apple is always even.



Let me know if you'd like me to elaborate on any part of the problem!

You are given the number of buyers and the price of a single item. For each buyer, you are told if they received a half-item as a gift in addition to buying half the available items. Calculate the total amount of money earned from all the sales.
